meanings.sent1: The roller coaster made me feel qualmy.
meanings.sent2: She looked qualmy after eating too much candy.
meanings.sent3: The thought of eating snails made him feel qualmy.
meanings.sent4: The dark, musty room had a qualmy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The smell of rotten eggs was so qualmy it made me gag.

meanings.definition: Causing a feeling of unease or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The eerie silence in the abandoned house was quite qualmy.
meanings.sent2: The creepy movie had a qualmy effect on the audience.
meanings.sent3: The clown's painted smile looked qualmy in the dim light.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious stranger had a qualmy presence about him.
meanings.sent5: The creaking floorboards added to the qualmy feeling in the old house.
